terms_and_conditions_content:
Masaj

Welcome to our platform, which provides a distinctive and unique services of electronic booking, payment for massage and Salon services at your own premises in a fast, reliable, secure and digitized manner. These terms and conditions (Terms and Conditions) set out below form the basis of the relationship between you (User “you”) and our platform (“Masaj” The platform). You agree and acknowledge that these terms and conditions may be amended from time to time.

must be 18 years old or over to access and use the Platform, if you are under this age, you must obtain your guardian's consent or you must stop accessing and using our Platform, we will not be liable for that in any case.

Masaj is a service provider and we will not be at any time under any circumstances liable for any injuries, bad behavior, shortages of providing service, mis understanding that may arise from the practitioner.

1- Access and intellectual property:

1.1 Subject to the specified access restrictions, our Platform grants the User during this term a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable, non-assignable, non-sublicensable right to use the Platform in accordance with, and only as necessary to receive, the services contemplated under this Agreement.

1.2 Except as expressly provided in the User Agreement, User shall not (nor shall permit any third-party or attempt to) directly or indirectly:

(a) interfere in any way with the proper functionality or working of the Platform Dashboard, Platform APIs or the Platform Website - if applicable-;

(b) modify, alter, tamper with, translate, repair or create derivative works from the Dashboard Model, Platform APIs, or Platform Website;

(c) reverse engineer, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to discover the source code, configuration code, underlying structure, ideas, or algorithms of the Platform Dashboard or Platform APIs;

(d) attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Platform Dashboard, Platform APIs, the server(s) on which they are stored or any other server, network, computer or database connected to the Platform Portal or the Platform Website.

(e) use the Services or the Platform Documentation for purposes other than those set forth in this Agreement; or make them available.

(f) sell, distribute, rent, assign, sub-contract, transfer or pledge rights to the Services, or make available or offer any aspect of the Services or the Platform Documentation to any third party or on any file processing or use of the Service or the Platform documentation for or on behalf of any third party, without the prior express written consent of the Platform.

(g) use the Services in a manner that may damage, disable, overburden, impair or damage the Platform's systems or security, or interfere with other users of the Platform Portal;

(h) use the Services to create a product, service or application that competes with any product, service or application of the Platform; or

(i) Transmit any defamatory, offensive or otherwise objectionable material in connection with the Services.

(j) User acknowledges and agrees that any breach of the access restrictions will form a material breach of the User Agreement.

1.3 For the avoidance of doubt, this Agreement does not transfer any property whatsoever, as the rights remain wholly owned by the Platform. The Platform retains all right, title and interest in the Services, the Platform Account, the Platform Dashboard, the Platform APIs, the Platform Documentation and all related intellectual property rights. This Agreement does not provide any right to the source code or decompiled software owned, used or licensed by the Platform. The User acknowledges that the Platform documentation is confidential information and must remain that way at all times and protected by the Platform's copyrights.

2- Law and Jurisdiction:

2.1 Your acceptance of this agreement and the terms is considered as a certified electronic signature registered in our electronic system and confirms the validity of this agreement, by applying the provisions of Law No. 20/2014 for electronic transactions.

2.2 All electronic data and information provided, shared, maintained, used on or through the Platform are subject to the terms of Regulation 42/2021 regarding privacy protection.

2.3 This Agreement and the Terms and Conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Kuwait.

2.4 Any disputes relating to this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the courts of Kuwait.

3- Managing and operating the account on the platform

3.1 The User acknowledges and agrees that he remains solely responsible for the management and operation of his Platform account, contact data (credentials) and passwords relating to Users. The User further acknowledges and agrees that the Platform shall not be liable for any losses or damages of any kind incurred by the User as a result of his or the service providers misuse of the Platform (including negligence, willful misconduct, improper use, or unexpected use as unintended in this Agreement), or as a result of any change made to the Platform Portal by anyone other than the Platform.

4 - Amendments:

4.1 We may modify these Terms at any time in our sole discretion and if we do so, we will notify you of the revised Terms by email and/or notifications feature. The modifications will be effective from the date specified in each notification, except those changes addressing new functionality of the Service or changes made for legal reasons will be effective immediately. You are obligated to review these Terms periodically so that you are aware of any modifications. Your continued access to and use of the Platform and Services after such modifications constitutes your acknowledgment and agreement to be bound by these Terms and Conditions as modified.

5- Data Security:

5.1 User agrees to comply with all rules, regulations, standards or guidelines approved or required by applicable laws relating to privacy, data security, protection, disclosure and processing of Customer Transaction Data, in each case as may be amended from time to time.

5.2 The User will immediately notify the Platform if he receives or suspects any error, falsification or inaccuracy of his Information.

5.3 The Platform may keep the User information that the User approve to share.

5.4 The User agrees on a permanent basis that the Platform will process data (including personal information for example: name, email, mobile phone number) received from the User to perform its obligations under this Agreement. As required by applicable laws, the Platform is permitted to transfer such data to any third party if requested to do so for the successful implementation of the Services provided. The user expressly agrees on a permanent and continuous basis that the platform collects, stores and processes any data through the platform and for the purposes of this agreement, and the user must comply with the applicable laws related to data privacy.

6- License to use the platform:

6.1 You are required to maintain all information requested during your registration process so that it remains true, accurate, current and complete at all times, and you agree that we may access and view your information, including your name, email address and mobile phone number.

6.2 The User must use our Services. Subject to and in accordance with these Terms and other guidelines or instructions we include in and in accordance with the Service, we reserve the right to terminate your access to the Service at any time, for any or no reason and with or without notice; Unless you have violated these terms. You may not assign or transfer any of your rights or obligations under this Section or these Terms to any person or entity, and any attempt to do so is void and may terminate your access and use of the Platform.

10- Force Majeure

10.1 Neither party shall be liable to the other for any delay or non-performance of its obligations under this Agreement to the extent that such delay or non-performance arises from an act of God, governmental intervention, war, fire, flood, explosion or epidemic, civil commotion, armed hostilities, terrorist act, siege of revolution, siege, strike, lock-down, sit-in, industrial or commercial strife to the extent that these do not include Party officials who demand relief; accident (or breakdown) of a plant or machine, or shortage of any material, labor, transportation, electricity or other supply, or regulatory interference; bad weather or illness; any act or intervention of a competent judicial or regulatory authority; viruses or other defects resulting from unauthorized access to the Software, unauthorized access to the Platform Website, or any type of hacking, including any “denial of service” or other targeted network attack; loss of supply of essential services including electrical power, telecommunications, air conditioning and third party services; or any event (including any act or omission of any third party) outside its reasonable control which could not reasonably be planned or avoided (each a Force Majeure event), provided the affected party promptly notifies the other in writing Take all necessary measures to mitigate the impact of such delay or failure to perform the force majeure event and provide the corresponding evidence to the other party. This Agreement shall not be breached to the extent that such breach is a direct consequence of the relief event.

11- No partnership No agency

11.1 Nothing in this Agreement will create any partnership, joint venture, agency, franchise, sales representation or employment relationship between the parties.

12. Indemnifications

You agree to indemnify, defend (if required by us), and hold harmless our officers, directors, suppliers, partners and agents from and against any third-party claims, demands, losses, damages or expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising from (a) the Content that you post or submit, (b) your use of the Platform (c) your violation of these Terms, or (d) your violation of any rights of a third party. Your obligation to indemnify shall be effective even after the termination of these Terms and your use of the Platform.

13. No Assignment:

You may not assign or transfer these Terms (or the rights and licenses granted under them). For example, if you register an account as an employee of a company, your account cannot be transferred to another employee. We may assign these Terms (or the rights and licenses granted under them) to a company or other person without restriction. Nothing in these Terms confers any right, benefit or remedy to any third-party person or entity. You agree that your account is non-transferable and that all rights in your account and other rights under these Terms terminate upon your death.

14. Your content: rules

You warrant and represent that your content will comply with this agreement and terms and conditions.

Your content must not be illegal or unlawful, must not infringe any person's legal rights, and must not be capable of giving rise to legal action against any person (in each case in any jurisdiction and under any applicable law).

Your content, and the use of your content by us in accordance with this agreement and terms and conditions, must not:

(a) Be libelous or maliciously false;

(b) Be obscene or indecent;

(c) infringe any copyright, moral right, database right, trade mark right, design right, right in passing off, or other intellectual property right;

(d) Infringe any right of confidence, right of privacy or right under data protection legislation;

(e) Constitute negligent advice or contain any negligent statement;

(f) Constitute an incitement to commit a crime, instructions for the commission of a crime or the promotion of criminal activity;

(g) Be in contempt of any court, or in breach of any court order;

(h) Be in breach of racial or religious hatred or discrimination legislation;

(i) be blasphemous;

(j) Be in breach of official legislation;

(k) Be in breach of any contractual obligation owed to any person;

(l) Depict violence in an explicit, graphic or gratuitous manner.

(m) Be pornographic, lewd, suggestive or sexually explicit.

(n) Be untrue, false, inaccurate or misleading.

(o) Consist of or contain any instructions, advice or other information which may be acted upon and could, if acted upon, cause illness, injury or death, or any other loss or damage.

(p) Constitute spam

(q) Be offensive, deceptive, fraudulent, threatening, abusive, harassing, anti-social, menacing, hateful, discriminatory or inflammatory; or

(r) Cause annoyance, inconvenience or needless anxiety to any person.

15. Breach of this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions:

Without prejudice to our other rights under this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions, if you breach this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions in any way, or if we reasonably suspect that you have breached this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions in any way, we may:

(a) send you one or more formal warnings;

(b) Temporarily suspend your access to the Platform

(c) permanently prevent you from accessing the Platform.

(d) Prevent computers/mobile devices using your IP address from accessing the Platform

(e) Contact any or all of the Internet Service Providers and ask them to block your access to the Platform

(f) initiate legal action against you, whether for breach of this Agreement and the Terms and Conditions or otherwise;

(g) Suspension or deletion of your account on the Platform.

16. Severability

16.1 If a provision of this agreement and terms and conditions is determined by any court or other competent authority to be unlawful and/or unenforceable, the other provisions will continue in effect.

16.2 If any unlawful and/or unenforceable provision of this agreement and terms and conditions would be lawful or enforceable if part of it were deleted, that part will be deemed to be deleted, and the rest of the provision will continue in effect.

17. Third party rights:

17.1 This agreement and terms and conditions is for our benefit and your benefit, and is not intended to benefit or be enforceable by any third party.

17.2 The exercise of the parties' rights under this agreement and terms and conditions is not subject to the consent of any third party.

18. Booking Service, Cancelation and Refunds:

18.1 Our Platform provides the Booking Services to User for the purpose of assisting User in discovering and booking appointments available at query time and to confirm his booking through the provided/approved communication method.

18.2 Once the appointment is paid and confirmed an email shall be sent to the User with all necessary information.

18.3 In case the payment was not successful, the transaction and booked appointment shall be free, the Platform shall not be responsible if any other User booked the chosen available appointment.

18.4 The Platform will cancel any booked appointment if the chosen practitioner was of the opposite sex of the User, the Platform shall not be reliable for any responsibilities that may arise, User acknowledges that this action will be considered as a breach of contract, any paid amounts shall be confiscated as a compensation.

18.5 You have to contact us in any available communication method, in case you require any special needs before booking the available appointments.

18.6 Our Platform will not accept cash or checks for payments, in case you face difficulties in finalizing the electronic payment, you must contact the Platform Administration to assist you.

18.7 The User acknowledge that choosing and paying for available appointments shall be on his responsibility, canceling or changing the appointments may not be available in some cases, the Platform shall not be responsible in any way for any damages that may occur.

18.8 The Platform provide “Google Location Integration Services”, the User must use this service and allocate the desired address and location to guarantee that the chosen service is provided at full, changing location or address may not be accepted in some cases, the Platform shall not be responsible in any way for any damages that may occur.

18.9 User can cancel – in some cases and as the Platform deems acceptable – as follow:

(a) before 3 days from the appointment, in this case a full refund shall be made back to the same bank account used in payment.

(b) within 3 days or later from the appointment, there shall be no refunds.

18.10 The Platform may at its own decision make and require any information or documentations to engage a necessary investigation, if the cancelation was due to situation out of the User control.

19. User Obligation & rights:

19.1 The User acknowledge that the chosen service is based on his needs and requirements, any changes to or addition to the services whether before providing the services or at the time of the appointment is not acceptable. any violation to this obligation shall be considered as a breach of contract, the Platform shall cancel the appointment at once, no refunds shall be issued.

19.2 The user must fill all required forms to start the services at the premises, any refusal, miss or incorrect information shall be considered a breach of contract, the Platform shall cancel the appointment at once, no refunds shall be issued.

19.3 The User must inform the practitioner for any injuries or surgeries that may affect the quality or type of the services.

19.4 The User must inform the Platform administration at once and in maximum within 1 hour from the start of service for any issues that may rise related to the practitioner or the services.

19.5 User agree and accept to the right of the Platform to use any necessary mean to guarantee providing the services at full.
privacy_policy_content:
Masaj

1. Introduction

1.1 We are committed to safeguarding the privacy of our platform visitors; in this policy we explain how we will treat your personal information.

1.2 [We will ask you to consent to our use of cookies in accordance with the terms of this policy when you first visit our platform. / By using our platform and agreeing to this policy, you consent to our use of cookies in accordance with the terms of this policy.] for websites

1.3 Your acceptance of this Policy is considered to be an approved and signed electronic signature in our electronic system and confirms the validity of this policy, by applying the provisions of Law No. 20/2014 for electronic transactions.

1.4 All electronic data, information provided, offered, submitted, presented, shared, kept, used in or through the platform are governed with the terms of the regulation 42/2021 in regards to privacy protection.

1.5 This policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with [Kuwaiti laws].

1.6 Any disputes relating to this policy shall be subject to the jurisdiction of Kuwait courts.

1.7 We are linked to the server (_________), you can view the privacy policy through the following link: (________________).

2. Personal Information

2.1 We may collect, store and use the following kinds of personal information:

(a) [Information about your computer, mobile device or smart device and about your visits to and use of this Platform (including [your IP address, geographical location, browser type and version, operating system, referring source, duration of visit, page views, and navigation paths in the platform].

(b) Information you provide to us when registering on our Platform including your email address.

(c) [Information you provide when completing your profile on our Platform (including [your name, mobile phone number]);]

(d) [Information you provide to us for the purpose of subscribing to email notifications and/or newsletters (including [your name and email address]);]

(e) [Information that you provide to us when using the Services on our Platform, or that is generated during the use of such Services (including [the timing, frequency and pattern of service use]);]

(f) [Information we process online (including [name, email and mobile phone number]);]

(g) [Information contained in or relating to any communication you send to us or transmit through our Platform (including [the content of the communication and metadata associated with the communication]);]

(h) [Any other personal information you choose to send to us; And]

(i) [[Provide details of other personal information collected].]

2.2 Before you disclose to us the personal information of another person, you must obtain that person's consent to both the disclosure and the processing of that personal information in accordance with this Policy.

3. Use of personal information

3.1 Personal information submitted to us through our Platform will be used for the purposes specified in this Policy or on the relevant pages of the Platform.

3.2 We may use your personal information to:

(a) [Manage our Platform and our business;]

(b) [customize our Platform to you;]

(c) [enable your use of the services available on our Platform;]

(d) [Send you non-marketing commercial communications;]

(e) [send email notifications that you have specifically requested;]

(f) [send the newsletter by email, if you request it (you can inform us at any time if you no longer need the newsletter);]

(g) [send marketing communications relating to our business [or the businesses of carefully selected third parties] which we believe may be of interest to you, by mail or, if you specifically agree, by email or similar technology (you may inform us at any time if you no longer need marketing communications);]

(h) [provide third parties with statistical information about our users (but such third parties will not be able to identify any individual user from that information);]

(i) [Dealing with inquiries and complaints made about you  or in connection with our platform;]

(j) [Keep our Platform secure and prevent fraud;]

(k) [verify compliance with the terms and conditions governing the use of our Platform [(including monitoring private messages sent through the Platform’s private message service)]); And]

3.3 If you submit personal information for publication on our Platform, we will publish and otherwise use that information in accordance with the license you grant to us.

3.4 Your privacy settings may be used to limit the publication of your information on our Platform, and may be modified using the Platform's privacy controls.

3.5 We will not, without your express consent, provide your personal information to any third party for the purpose of direct marketing to them or to any third party.

4. Disclosure of personal information

4.1 We may disclose your personal information to [any of our employees, officers, insurers, professional advisors, agents, suppliers or our subcontractors] to the extent reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this Policy.

4.2 We may disclose your personal information to any member of our group of companies (that is, our affiliates, our holding company and all of our affiliates) to the extent reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this Policy.

4.3 We may disclose your personal information:

(a) to the extent we are required to do so by law;

(b) in connection with any ongoing or prospective legal proceedings;

(c) in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and credit risk reduction);

(d) [to the purchaser (or potential purchaser) of any business or asset that we are selling (or considering); And]

5. International data transfers

5.1 The information we collect may be processed and transferred between any of the countries in which we operate in order to enable us to use the information in accordance with this Policy.

5.2 Personal information you post on our platform or submit for publication on our Platform may be available, online, throughout the world. We cannot prevent the use or misuse of such information by others.

5.3 You expressly consent to the transfers of personal information described in this Section 6.

6. Retention of personal information

6.1 This Section 6 sets out our data retention policies and procedures, which are designed to help ensure that we comply with our legal obligations regarding the retention and deletion of personal information.

6.2 Personal information that we process for any purpose or purposes may not be retained for longer than is necessary for that purpose or those purposes.

6.3 Without prejudice to Section 6.2, we will normally delete Personal Data that falls within the categories below on the date/time specified below:

(a) [Personal data type] [date/time] will be deleted; And]

6.4 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Section 6, we will retain documents (including electronic documents) that contain personal data:

(a) to the extent we are required to do so by law;

(b) if we believe the documents may be relevant to any ongoing or potential legal proceedings; And

(c) in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and credit risk reduction).

7. Security of personal information

7.1 We will take reasonable technical and organizational precautions to prevent loss, misuse or alteration of your personal information.

7.2 You acknowledge that transmission of information over the Internet is not secure in nature, and we cannot guarantee the security of data transmitted over the Internet.

7.3 You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the password you use to access our Platform; We will not ask you for your password (except when you log into our platform).

5. International data transfers

5.1 The information we collect may be processed and transferred between any of the countries in which we operate in order to enable us to use the information in accordance with this Policy.

5.2 Personal information you post on our platform or submit for publication on our Platform may be available, online, throughout the world. We cannot prevent the use or misuse of such information by others.

5.3 You expressly consent to the transfers of personal information described in this Section 6.

6. Retention of personal information

6.1 This Section 6 sets out our data retention policies and procedures, which are designed to help ensure that we comply with our legal obligations regarding the retention and deletion of personal information.

6.2 Personal information that we process for any purpose or purposes may not be retained for longer than is necessary for that purpose or those purposes.

6.3 Without prejudice to Section 6.2, we will normally delete Personal Data that falls within the categories below on the date/time specified below:

(a) [Personal data type] [date/time] will be deleted; And]

6.4 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Section 6, we will retain documents (including electronic documents) that contain personal data:

(a) to the extent we are required to do so by law;

(b) if we believe the documents may be relevant to any ongoing or potential legal proceedings; And

(c) in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and credit risk reduction).

7. Security of personal information

7.1 We will take reasonable technical and organizational precautions to prevent loss, misuse or alteration of your personal information.

7.2 You acknowledge that transmission of information over the Internet is not secure in nature, and we cannot guarantee the security of data transmitted over the Internet.

7.3 You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the password you use to access our Platform; We will not ask you for your password (except when you log into our platform).

8. Amendments:

8.1 We may update this Policy from time to time by posting a new version on our Platform.

8.2 You should check this page from time to time to check for any changes to this Policy.

8.3 We may notify you of changes to this Policy [by email or through the private messaging system on our Platform].

9. Your rights

9.1 You may ask us to provide you with any personal information we hold about you.

9.2 We may withhold personal information that you request to the extent permitted by law.

9.3 You may ask us at any time not to process your personal information for marketing purposes.

9.4 In practice, you expressly consent in advance to our use of your personal information for marketing purposes, or we

will provide you with an opportunity to cancel our right to use your personal information for marketing purposes.

10. Third Party Platforms

10.1 Our Platform includes hyperlinks and details of third-party platforms.

10.2 We have no control over, and are not responsible for, the privacy policies and practices of third parties.

11. Information update

11.1 Please inform us if the personal information we hold about you needs to be corrected or updated.

12. Cookies

12.1 Our Platform uses cookies.

12.2 A cookie is a file containing an identifier (a string of letters and numbers) that is sent by the Platform's server to the Platform's browser and stored by the browser. The identifier is then sent back to the server each time the browser requests a page from the server.

12.3 Cookies may be either “persistent” cookies or “session” cookies: a persistent cookie will be stored by the Platform's browser and will remain valid until its specified expiration date, unless deleted by the user before the expiration date; On the other hand, the session cookie expires at the end of the user's session, when the platform's browser is closed.

12.4 Cookies do not normally contain any information that personally identifies a user, but personal information we store about you may be linked to and obtained from information stored in and obtained from cookies.

12.5 We use [session-only cookies / persistent cookies only / session cookies and persistent cookies] on our Platform.

12.6 The names of the cookies we use in our platform and the purposes for which they are used are described below:

(a) We use a cookie on our Platform [to recognize a computer when a user visits the Platform / Track users as they navigate the Platform / Optimize platform usability / Analyze platform usage / Manage fraud and improve platform security / Customize the Platform for each user / Advertisements Targeted that may be of particular interest to specific users/;

12.7 Most browsers allow you to refuse to accept cookies.

12.8 Blocking all cookies will have a negative impact on the usability of many of the Services.

12.9 If you block cookies, you will not be able to use all the features of our Platform.

12.10 You can delete cookies already stored on your computer.

12.11 Deleting cookies will have a negative impact on the usability of many of the Services.
reschedule_policy_content:
You can reschedule your appointment 24 hours before the appointment time with no penalty.

If you reschedule within 4 to 24 hours’ notice prior to the appointment, we charge 50% of the appointment total.

If you reschedule with less than 4 hours’ notice prior to the appointment, we charge 100% of the appointment total.
cancellation_policy_content:
You can cancel your appointment 24 hours before the appointment with no penalty.

If you cancel within 6 to 24 hours' notice prior to the appointment, we charge 50% of the appointment total.

If you cancel with less than 6 hours' notice prior to the appointment, we charge 100% of the appointment total.

If you cancel with a refund in any case, we will charge the refund fees from your amount.
